title: MYLINOS
content:
MYLINOS (Mylinus) was a little-known giant of the island of Krete (Crete) slain by the god Zeus.

Mylinos is similar to, if not the same as, the Kretan giant Olympos. Both of
        these appear to be related to Kronos (Cronus) (Time), father of Zeus.
        His name means "millstone" from the Greek word mylinos. The millstone might symbolise the
        slow revolution of time which grinds down all things, similar to the all-devouring Titan Kronos of standard
        Greek myth.

Diodorus Siculus, Library of History 5. 71. 2 (trans. Oldfather) (Greek historian
          C1st B.C.) :
        "He [Zeus] slew the Gigantes (Giants) and their followers, Mylinos in Krete (Crete) and Typhon in
        Phrygia."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
